channel.title: One Problem After Another
channel.description:
Server error! The server encountered an internal error and was unable to complete your request. Either the server is overloaded or there was an error in a CGI script. If you think this is a server error, please contact the webmaster. Error 500 localhost 26/03/2011 10:36:02 Apache/2.2.17 (Win32) mod_ssl/2.2.17 OpenSSL/0.9.8o PHP/5.3.4 mod_perl/2.0.4 Perl/v5.10.1
As far as I'm aware I haven't done anything wrong but this seems to think otherwise. I've not changed directories or passwords. I log in to root and this comes up straight away. I finaly got my server running and MySQL localhost was fine, then I turned off the sever and tried to edit my MySQL file and now it won't let me in, anybody else had this occurrence?

item.title: One Problem After Another
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Server error! The server encountered an internal error and was unable to complete your request. Either the server is overloaded or there was an error in a CGI script.

If you think this is a server error, please contact the webmaster.

Error 500
localhost
26/03/2011 10:36:02
Apache/2.2.17 (Win32) mod_ssl/2.2.17 OpenSSL/0.9.8o PHP/5.3.4 mod_perl/2.0.4 Perl/v5.10.1

As far as I’m aware I haven’t done anything wrong but this seems to think otherwise. I’ve not changed directories or passwords.

I log in to root and this comes up straight away.

I finaly got my server running and MySQL localhost was fine, then I turned off the sever and tried to edit my MySQL file and now it won’t let me in, anybody else had this occurrence?

Read full topic
